prep.description: Get butter to room temperature; take it out of the fridge for a few hours until it is very soft to the touch
Place butter in a large mixing bowl
Use the microplane to zest the lemon over the butter
Add sugar to the mixing bowl; mix until well-combined
Crack the egg and add it to the bowl
Add vanilla extract to the bowl; mix until well-combined
Place blueberries into a separate bowl
Add a quarter-cup flour to the blueberry bowl; toss the blueberries in the flour until coated
Place the remaining flour into a separate bowl
Add salt and baking powder to the flour bowl; whisk until combined
Position the center-rack in the oven; start pre-heating to 375 degrees F
Slowly add dry flour mixture to the wet ingredients; alternate with pouring in milk; mix until well-combined
Line 12 cup muffin tin with baking cups
Use the disher to evenly distribute batter to baking cups

cook.description: Place muffin tin into oven and bake for 26 minutes
Check for internal temperature of 209 degrees F in the center of the largest muffin

prep.description: wash the squash under water with a brush
slice off the ends of the squash, then cut in half lengthwise, and scoop out seeds and innards
slice each half into quarter-inch width segments
place segments onto a baking sheet. Add olive oil, then a couple pinches of salt and generous shake of pepper
use your hands to spread oil and seasonings around squash segments. Make sure each segment has a light coating of oil

cook.description: flip segments with a spatula, then bake for 15 more minutes. Squash should be browned and very soft when done

ingredients.name: pork chop (boneless or bone-in; the thicker, the better)

prep.description: finely chop the rosemary
mince the garlic cloves
season the pork chops with salt and pepper on both sides
preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit

cook.description: slice the butter into one-tablespoon segments, then microwave to melt
mix rosemary and garlic into the melted butter
heat olive oil on an oven-safe pan or skillet
once oil heats up, sear the pork chops four minutes total on each side until browned. If thickness allows, also sear any fatty side to render off the fat as much as possible
brush the top with the garlicky rosemary butter, then roast on the center rack until thickest part of each pork chop comes to temperature: 140 degrees Fahrenheit.
